entry.title: Entry #104 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MINUTE entry before the Honorable John F. Kness: For the reasons provided in the accompanying Memorandum Opinion and Order, which is being entered separately, the motion of Defendants Fenix International Limited and Fenix Internet, LLC to dismiss under the doctrine of forum non conveniens is granted. Case dismissed without prejudice. Enter separate final judgment order. Civil case terminated. Mailed notice. (exr, ) (Entered: 09/29/2025)

entry.title: Entry #103 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MINUTE entry before the Honorable John F. Kness: With regret for the late notice, the Court strikes the case tracking hearing set for tomorrow (9/3/2025). Further guidance will be provided promptly by separate order. Mailed notice (jfk) (Entered: 09/02/2025)

entry.title: Entry #102 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: TRANSCRIPT OF PROCEEDINGS, evidentiary hearing, held on 5/21/2025 before the Honorable John F. Kness. Order Number: 51945. Court Reporter Contact Information: Nancy LaBella, Nancy_LaBella@ilnd.uscourts.gov, 312-435-6890. IMPORTANT: The transcript may be viewed at the court's public terminal or purchased through the Court Reporter/Transcriber before the deadline for Release of Transcript Restriction. After that date it may be obtained through the Court Reporter/Transcriber or PACER. For further information on the redaction process, see the Court's web site at www.ilnd.uscourts.gov under Quick Links select Policy Regarding the Availability of Transcripts of Court Proceedings. Redaction Request due 8/21/2025. Redacted Transcript Deadline set for 9/1/2025. Release of Transcript Restriction set for 10/29/2025. (Labella, Nancy) (Entered: 07/31/2025)

entry.title: Entry #101 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MINUTE entry before the Honorable John F. Kness: In a joint statement 100, the parties have confirmed that neither party intends to submit additional briefing on the motion to dismiss (Dkt. 21, 22, 41, 54). The motion is thus taken under advisement. A telephonic hearing for motion tracking purposes is set for 9/3/2025 at 9:30 A.M. The parties are to use the following call-in number: 1-855-244-8681, Access Code: 2315 003 3696. The public and media representatives may have access to the hearing via the same number. Audio recording of the hearing is not permitted; violations of this prohibition may result in sanctions. Participants are directed to keep their device muted when they are not speaking. Mailed notice. (exr, ) (Entered: 07/24/2025)

entry.title: Entry #91 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151

entry.title: Entry #90 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MINUTE entry before the Honorable John F. Kness: This order addresses several open matters in this case. As explained in the accompanying order and statement, the May 21, 2025 hearing involving the parties' English law experts will pertain to the operative 2021 version of the OnlyFans Terms of Service. Those witnesses may appear by remote videoconference. The pending motions to seal (Dkt. 39, 48) are granted in part and denied in part. On or before May 21, 2025, the parties are directed to file public copies of the relevant filings redacted in accordance with the separate order and statement. Defendants' unopposed motion 89 seeking a status hearing is denied without prejudice, as the Court intends to enter a separate minute order within the next day or two addressing the remaining logistical questions posed in the motion seeking a hearing. If following entry of that order the parties still desire clarification, either or both may contact the Courtroom Deputy and request a hearing. Enter separate order and statement. Mailed notice. (pk, ) (Entered: 05/06/2025)

entry.title: Entry #89 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MOTION by Defendants Fenix International Limited, Fenix Internet, LLC for Status Hearing (Unopposed) (Kutcher, Matthew) (Entered: 05/05/2025)

entry.title: Entry #87 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MINUTE entry before the Honorable John F. Kness: For the reasons stated in Plaintiffs' unopposed motion, the Court finds that the case M. Brunner, et al. v. Fenix Internet, LLC, et al., No. 25-cv-03244 (Cummings, J.) is related, within the meaning of LR 40.4, to this case. Accordingly, consistent with LR 40.4, the Court asks that the Executive Committee reassign M. Brunner, et al. v. Fenix Internet, LLC, et al., No. 25-cv-03244, to this Court's calendar.Motion to reassign case 86 is grantedMailed notice (exr, ) (Entered: 04/14/2025)

entry.title: Entry #81 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: ANNUAL REMINDER: Pursuant to Local Rule 3.2 (Notification of Affiliates), any nongovernmental party, other than an individual or sole proprietorship, must file a statement identifying all its affiliates known to the party after diligent review or, if the party has identified no affiliates, then a statement reflecting that fact must be filed. An affiliate is defined as follows: any entity or individual owning, directly or indirectly (through ownership of one or more other entities), 5% or more of a party. The statement is to be electronically filed as a PDF in conjunction with entering the affiliates in CM/ECF as prompted. As a reminder to counsel, parties must supplement their statements of affiliates within thirty (30) days of any change in the information previously reported. This minute order is being issued to all counsel of record to remind counsel of their obligation to provide updated information as to additional affiliates if such updating is necessary. If counsel has any questions regarding this process, this LINK will provide additional information. Signed by the Honorable Virginia M. Kendall on 12/27/2024: Mailed notice. (tg, ) (Entered: 12/28/2024)

entry.title: Entry #80 in McFadden v. Fenix Internet, LLC, 1:23-cv-06151
entry.summary: MINUTE entry before the Honorable John F. Kness: Telephonic status hearing held 12/12/2024. As discussed on the record, the Court will set a hearing to hear testimony from the parties' English law experts concerning the validity of the forum selection clause. A substantive order expanding on the reasoning for this decision will be issued separately. The courtroom deputy will reach out to the parties to find a date for the hearing, which will be held by remote means (logistical details to follow). The parties informed the Court that negotiations on the pending motion to seal 48 have stalled. That motion is taken under advisement and will be resolved by separate order. Mailed notice. (exr, ) (Entered: 12/16/2024)
